Hello and welcome to my first post!  I am very pleased to have come this far.  I have to admit, I'm not really sure I know what I'm doing with blogdown!  **Disclaimer alert** if any links on the site don't work, please leave me a comment and I'll try to fix them.

Today I'm planning on deploying the site using Netlify because that's what I've read on a couple of other blogs (https://alison.rbind.io/post/up-and-running-with-blogdown/). It is supposed to be relatively easy for deployment and site maintenance.

My last job of this weekend is to set up my DH22 (https://www.adafruit.com/product/385) in the greenhouse using my Raspberry Pi - this is a temperature and humidity sensor (bought from eBay for Â£4.20).  I will be making a database using MySQL and storing the temperature and humidity data there (links to the tutorial will be in the next post).  I will also upload the data onto the site and attempt (in the future) to hook up a live stream, but I need to get better with coding before I can do that.  For now, I will settle with a summary of the data.  I intend to collect it hourly because I'm going to attach a battery pack to the Pi, so I need to see how long it lasts before it runs out of juice... more to come when I've set it all up!
